intro: Gerascanthus roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its latex contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Despite its toxic properties, it is occasionally cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance.
